discussion.author: pi8027
discussion.comment: There was a discussion about this PR. The conclusion is that we do not have to drop support for Coq 8.10, but deprecation warnings will not arise in Coq 8.10 if we switch the deprecation mechanism as this PR does.

discussion.author: pi8027
discussion.comment:
```
# File "./ssreflect.v", line 82, characters 0-226:
# Error: This command does not support this attribute: deprecated.
```
So we have to drop support for Coq 8.10 to merge this PR. @CohenCyril

discussion.author: CohenCyril
discussion.comment:
> So we have to drop support for Coq 8.10 to merge this PR. @CohenCyril

Hence I have wrong memories about this...

discussion.author: pi8027
discussion.comment: Since we have reached a consensus in the last meeting and now we have Coq 8.13 in CI, this PR is ready for review.

review_discussion.author: pi8027
review_discussion.comment: These deprecation aliases are quite old (deprecated in MathComp 1.9.0). So there is probably no reason to keep them.

review_discussion.author: pi8027
review_discussion.comment: Should I simply add `"8.13"` here BTW?

review_discussion.author: CohenCyril
review_discussion.comment: No, it requires an update of nixpkgs, but since I did a huge refactoring, it will not be compatible with the current configuration for mathcomp. Please leave it out, I will come back and fix it asap.

review_discussion.author: pi8027
review_discussion.comment: So I removed them (in a separate commit for ease of review).

tags.description: This issure/PR is about cleaning up obsolete code, removing hacks, etc
Addressing this issue or merging this PR requires to drop support for coq 8.10

commits.author: pi8027
commits.message:
Drop support for Coq 8.10 and deprecate the `deprecate` notation

- The `deprecate` notation and `iota_add` have been deprecated. All the uses of
  the `deprecate` notation have been replaced with the `deprecated` attribute.
- Deprecation aliases in `ssrnat` and `ssrnum` introduced in MathComp 1.11+beta1
  have been removed.
- Remove `VDFILE` related hacks from `Makefile.common`.
